COPY
Sent for the information of
Mr. Robert Underwood,
Educational Television and Radio Center
1610 WASHTENAW AVENUE
ANN ARBOR. MICHIGAN
August 3, 1957
Mr. Burt cm Paulu
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 14, Minnesota
Dear Burt:
Here are some factual comments on the proposal which Ralph
Hall of Kent State University made to Harry Skornia in June;
1# At the outset it should be made clear that we are speaking
only of radio programs* This is probably implied in the
Kent State letter but nowhere is it stated.
2. There are no radio programs produced ”bye’ the ETRC.
ETRC ie not a production center hut makes grants -in-aid
to various stations to aid in the production of radio pro*
grams.
3. ETRC does not control' all rights. ETRC (and before it
NASS} secured from institutions producing the programs
only the radio broadcasting rights. It is not a matter of
record mid not known whether the various producing organ!*
3 at ions secured anything more than radio broadcasting
rights (with TV rights to the title, idea, format, and scripts).
4. The master tapes of all grant programs done in the past
have been shipped to NAEB headquarters and retained there
in order to reproduce tapes for NAEB's member stations
for radio broadcasting.
With the facts straight*-here are some comments:
a. We have all had the experience of trying to go back and
clear up or obtain additional rights to programs after they
have been recorded and I for one will go on record as say
ing that it is a difficult and many times impossible task.
